Title: Email/Password Registration
Description: The system shall allow a new user to register for an account using a valid email address and a secure password.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user provides a valid email and password, when they submit the registration form, then a new user account is created.
Error / Edge Cases: User enters an invalid email format; User enters a password that does not meet security requirements; User tries to register with an email that already exists.
Testing Notes: Test with valid and invalid email formats; Test password strength rules; Test registration with an existing email.

Title: Social Login (Google/Apple)
Description: The system shall allow a new user to register and log in using their Google or Apple account.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user selects a social login option, when they successfully authenticate with the provider, then a new user account is created and they are logged in.
Non-Functional Needs: Secure handling of social login tokens
Error / Edge Cases: User denies permission from the social provider; API from the social provider is unavailable.
Technical Notes: API keys for Google and Apple developer accounts
Data / Fields: User profile data from social provider (name, email)
Testing Notes: Test successful social login; Test handling of user denial; Test error handling for API unavailability.

Title: User Login
Description: The system shall allow a registered user to log in using their email and password.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a registered user provides their correct email and password, when they submit the login form, then they are authenticated and granted access to the app.
Error / Edge Cases: User enters incorrect credentials; User account is locked.
Testing Notes: Test login with correct and incorrect credentials; Test handling of locked accounts.

Title: Demographic Information Capture
Description: The system shall provide dropdown selections for demographic details: Gender (Man, Woman, Non-Binary, Rather Not Say), Sexual Orientation (Straight, Gay, Bisexual, Rather Not Say), Relationship Construct (Monogamous, Open, Rather Not Say).
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user is in profile setup, when they select demographic options from dropdowns, then the data is saved. If 'Rather Not Say' is selected, system assumes gender/orientation compatible with all users and relationship construct is Open.
Error / Edge Cases: User skips this step.
Testing Notes: Test saving of demographic data; Test that the user can proceed without filling out this information.

Title: Intimacy Profile Survey Presentation
Description: The system shall present the intimacy profile survey to the user in a clear and engaging format.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user starts the intimacy profile survey, when they are presented with a question, then the question and possible answers are displayed clearly.
Testing Notes: Test that all survey questions and answers are displayed correctly.

Title: Intimacy Profile Survey Auto-Save
Description: The system shall automatically save the user's survey progress as they navigate through the survey.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user is taking the survey, when they click 'next page' or navigate to the next question, then their current answers are automatically saved.
Error / Edge Cases: User quits the app midway through the survey.
Testing Notes: Test that survey answers are saved correctly; Test that the app can handle incomplete surveys.

Title: Intimacy Profile Generation
Description: The system shall generate an intimacy profile assessment based on the user's survey answers.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has completed the survey, when they view their profile, then a personalized intimacy assessment is displayed.
Error / Edge Cases: The AI service is unavailable.
Testing Notes: Test the accuracy and relevance of the generated profile; Test error handling for AI service unavailability.

Title: Anonymous Mode
Description: The system shall allow users to use the app in an anonymous mode, which does not require registration.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a new user opens the app, when they select the anonymous mode, then they can access limited features without creating an account.
Testing Notes: Test that anonymous users can access the specified limited features; Test that anonymous users are prompted to register for full access.

Title: Single-Player ToD Game Setup
Description: The system shall allow a user to start a single-player Truth or Dare game with an anonymous opponent.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user selects the single-player ToD mode, when they start the game, then a new game session is created with an anonymous opponent.
Testing Notes: Test that a single-player game can be started successfully.

Title: Partner Connection
Description: The system shall allow a user to connect with a partner's account to play a two-player Truth or Dare game.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user wants to play with a partner, when they send a connection request and the partner accepts, then their accounts are linked for the game session.
Error / Edge Cases: Partner declines the connection request; Partner is not found.
Testing Notes: Test the partner connection flow, including sending, accepting, and declining requests.

Title: Personalized ToD Activity Generation
Description: The system shall use an AI integration to generate personalized Truth or Dare activities based on the players' intimacy profiles and the selected intimacy level.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a ToD game is in progress, when a new activity is requested, then the system generates an activity that is appropriate for the players' profiles and the game's intimacy level.
Error / Edge Cases: The AI service is unavailable.
Testing Notes: Test the relevance and variety of the generated activities; Test error handling for AI service unavailability.

Title: Intimacy Level Filtering
Description: The system shall filter Truth or Dare activities based on the selected intimacy level (Platonic, Exploring, Intimate).
Acceptance Criteria: Given a game has a specific intimacy level set, when a new activity is generated, then the activity conforms to the rules of that intimacy level (e.g., no erotic content for Platonic).
Testing Notes: Test that the activities generated for each intimacy level are appropriate.

Title: Skip Activity Function
Description: The system shall allow a player to skip a Truth or Dare activity and receive a new activity of the same type.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a player is presented with a Truth activity, when they skip it, then a new Truth activity is presented. Given a player is presented with a Dare activity, when they skip it, then a new Dare activity is presented.
Testing Notes: Test that the skip function works and that a new activity is generated.

Title: Profile Sharing
Description: The system shall allow a user to share their intimacy profile with another user.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user wants to share their profile, when they select a partner to share with, then the partner receives a notification and can view the user's profile.
Error / Edge Cases: Partner does not have the app installed.
Testing Notes: Test the profile sharing flow.

Title: Profile Overlap Visualization
Description: The system shall display a visualization of the overlap and conflicts between two users' intimacy profiles.
Acceptance Criteria: Given two users have shared their profiles, when they view their compatibility, then a visual representation of their profile similarities and differences is displayed.
Testing Notes: Test the accuracy and clarity of the overlap visualization.

Title: Random Participant Selection
Description: The system shall randomly select a participant using a spinner animation when requested.
Acceptance Criteria: Given multiple participants are in a game, when the spinner is activated, then a random participant is selected with equal probability.
Error / Edge Cases: Only one participant in the game.
Testing Notes: Test randomness and equal probability distribution across multiple spins.

Title: Random Truth or Dare Selection
Description: The system shall randomly select between Truth or Dare using a spinner animation when requested.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a participant has been selected, when the ToD spinner is activated, then either Truth or Dare is randomly selected.
Testing Notes: Test randomness of Truth vs Dare selection.

Title: Explicit Truth or Dare Choice
Description: The system shall allow a participant to explicitly choose Truth or Dare instead of spinning.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a participant has been selected, when they choose to manually select Truth or Dare, then the system accepts their choice.
Testing Notes: Test that both Truth and Dare can be explicitly selected.

Title: Comfort Level Overlap Calculation
Description: The system shall calculate the overlapping comfort levels of all participants in a game session.
Acceptance Criteria: Given multiple participants with different comfort levels, when a game starts, then the system determines the most restrictive common comfort level.
Error / Edge Cases: Participants have no overlapping comfort zones.
Testing Notes: Test with various combinations of participant comfort levels.

Title: Anonymous User Comfort Level Application
Description: The system shall limit ToD content to the signed-in user's comfort level when playing with an anonymous user.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user is playing with an anonymous opponent, when activities are generated, then they respect only the signed-in user's comfort level.
Testing Notes: Test that anonymous games respect the user's boundaries.

Title: Intimacy Level G Rules
Description: The system shall ensure that Intimacy Level G (Platonic) does not include any erotic or sexual activities.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a game is set to Intimacy Level G, when activities are generated, then no erotic or sexual content is included.
Testing Notes: Test that G-rated activities are appropriate for platonic relationships.

Title: Intimacy Level R Rules (Soft and Hard Limits)
Description: The system shall ensure that Intimacy Level R (Exploring) respects both soft and hard limits.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a game is set to Intimacy Level R, when activities are generated, then they respect participants' soft and hard boundaries.
Testing Notes: Test that R-rated activities respect soft boundaries.

Title: Intimacy Level X Rules
Description: The system shall ensure that Intimacy Level X (Intimate) respects hard limits.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a game is set to Intimacy Level X, when activities are generated, then they respect participants' hard boundaries.
Testing Notes: Test that X-rated activities respect hard boundaries.

Title: Free Tier Feature Access
Description: The system shall allow free users to access survey, profile view, and anonymous play features.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has a free account, when they access the app, then they can take the survey, view their profile, and play with anonymous users.
Testing Notes: Test that free users can access specified features.

Title: Daily Activity Limit Enforcement
Description: The system shall limit free users to X activities per day.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a free user has reached their daily activity limit, when they attempt another activity, then they are blocked and shown an upgrade prompt.
Testing Notes: Test that the daily limit is enforced and resets properly.

Title: Subscription Validation
Description: The system shall validate a user's subscription status and grant full access to subscribed users.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has an active subscription, when they access the app, then all features are available without limitations.
Error / Edge Cases: Subscription expires; Subscription payment fails.
Technical Notes: Integration with app store subscription services
Testing Notes: Test subscription validation and feature access; Test handling of expired subscriptions.

Title: Upgrade Prompt Display
Description: The system shall display an upgrade prompt when free users reach their daily limit or attempt to access premium features.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a free user encounters a limitation, when the limitation is triggered, then an upgrade prompt with subscription options is displayed.
Testing Notes: Test that upgrade prompts appear at appropriate times.

Title: AI Activity Generation
Description: The system shall use an AI integration to generate Truth or Dare activities dynamically.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a game requires a new activity, when the system requests one, then the AI generates an appropriate activity based on context.
Error / Edge Cases: AI generation process should be transparent to the user; they should experience seamless activity delivery.
Testing Notes: Test AI activity generation quality and appropriateness; Test fallback for AI unavailability.

Title: Reference Content Integration
Description: The system shall incorporate provided reference materials (surveys, Kama Sutra, etc.) into the AI's activity generation prompts.
Acceptance Criteria: Given reference content is available, when the AI generates activities, then the activities reflect themes and concepts from the reference materials.
Testing Notes: Test that generated activities align with reference content.

Title: Activity Tracking
Description: The system shall track all activities presented to each user to prevent repetition.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user is presented with an activity, when the activity is shown, then it is logged in the user's activity history.
Testing Notes: Test that activities are logged correctly.

Title: No-Repeat Logic
Description: The system shall not repeat activities for the same user within the first year or 100 activities, whichever comes first.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has seen an activity, when new activities are generated, then previously seen activities are excluded until the threshold is met.
Error / Edge Cases: User has seen all available activities.
Testing Notes: Test that activities are not repeated within the specified threshold.

Title: Random Activity Selection
Description: The system shall randomly select activities from the pool of appropriate activities.
Acceptance Criteria: Given multiple appropriate activities are available, when an activity is needed, then one is randomly selected.
Testing Notes: Test randomness of activity selection.

Title: Edit Survey Responses
Description: The system shall allow users to edit their survey responses and regenerate their intimacy profile.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user wants to update their profile, when they edit survey responses and submit, then their profile is regenerated with the new data.
Testing Notes: Test that profile updates reflect edited responses.

Title: Automatic Boundary Inference from Survey
Description: The system shall automatically infer and set boundaries based on survey responses: Disagree/Strongly Disagree = hard boundary, Neutral/Unsure = soft boundary.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user completes the survey, when responses are processed, then boundaries are automatically set based on response values and saved to the user profile.
Testing Notes: Test that boundaries can be set and saved correctly.

Title: Multi-Device Game Session
Description: The system shall allow users to connect and play Truth or Dare across multiple devices.
Acceptance Criteria: Given two users want to play on separate devices, when they connect, then a synchronized game session is created.
Error / Edge Cases: Network connectivity issues; Devices go out of sync.
Testing Notes: Test multi-device synchronization and error handling.

Title: Group Game (3+ Players)
Description: The system shall support Truth or Dare games with 3 or more players.
Acceptance Criteria: Given 3 or more users want to play together, when they create a group game, then all participants are included in the session.
Error / Edge Cases: One participant disconnects.
Testing Notes: Test group game creation and participant management.

Title: Activity Feedback Collection
Description: The system shall allow users to provide feedback on each activity (like/dislike, executed/not executed).
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user completes or skips an activity, when they provide feedback, then the feedback is saved and used to improve future recommendations.
Testing Notes: Test that feedback is captured and stored correctly.

Title: AI Learning from Feedback
Description: The system shall use user feedback to improve future activity recommendations.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has provided feedback on activities, when new activities are generated, then the AI considers the feedback to personalize recommendations.
Technical Notes: Machine learning model for feedback incorporation
Testing Notes: Test that recommendations improve based on feedback.

Title: Theme Diversity Filter
Description: The system shall ensure that activities within a single game session cover diverse themes and avoid repetitive topics.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a game session is active, when activities are generated, then no more than 2 consecutive activities share the same primary theme.
Error / Edge Cases: Limited activity pool for selected filters.
Testing Notes: Test that consecutive activities have different themes.

Title: Novelty Introduction Logic
Description: The system shall gradually introduce new topics and activity types to users over time based on their engagement history.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has completed multiple sessions, when new activities are generated, then the system includes a mix of familiar and new topics weighted toward gradual exploration.
Error / Edge Cases: User has explored all available topics.
Technical Notes: Novelty scoring algorithm based on user history
Testing Notes: Test that new topics are introduced at an appropriate rate.

Title: Content Appropriateness Validation
Description: The system shall validate that all generated activities are appropriate for the selected intimacy level and respect all participant boundaries.
Acceptance Criteria: Given an activity is generated, when it is validated, then it must pass all boundary checks and intimacy level requirements before being presented to users.
Dependencies: FR-12 (intimacy level filtering), FR-19 (comfort level overlap), FR-21/22/23 (level rules)
Error / Edge Cases: AI generates content that violates boundaries; validation service fails.
Technical Notes: Multi-layer validation: AI prompt engineering, post-generation filtering, content moderation
Testing Notes: Test with boundary-violating content; Test with inappropriate level content; Test validation failure handling.

Title: Skip Nudge Detection
Description: The system shall detect when a user has skipped 3 consecutive activities and trigger a nudge.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user skips an activity, when the skip count reaches 3 consecutive skips, then a helpful nudge is displayed suggesting to lower the intimacy level or review boundaries.
Testing Notes: Test that nudge appears after exactly 3 consecutive skips; Test that counter resets after completing an activity.

Title: Skip Nudge Content
Description: The system shall display a nudge message offering options to lower intimacy level or review boundaries when 3 consecutive skips occur.
Acceptance Criteria: Given the skip nudge is triggered, when displayed to the user, then it offers actionable options: lower intimacy level, review boundaries, or continue playing.
Testing Notes: Test that all nudge options are functional and lead to appropriate actions.

Title: Profile Visualization Rendering
Description: The system shall render the user's intimacy profile results in a visual format including charts, tags, and archetype labels.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user views their profile results, when the page loads, then visual elements (radar chart or similar) display their intimacy dimensions with clear labels and explanations.
Error / Edge Cases: Chart rendering fails; data incomplete.
Testing Notes: Test chart rendering with various profile data; Test accessibility of visual elements.

Title: Profile Results Call-to-Action
Description: The system shall display a clear call-to-action (CTA) after the user views their profile results, encouraging them to start playing.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has viewed their profile results, when the visualization is complete, then a prominent CTA button is displayed inviting them to start their first game.
Testing Notes: Test that CTA is visible and functional; Test that CTA leads to game setup.

Title: Anonymous App Access
Description: The system shall allow users to access the app without registration, storing their profile locally and sending it anonymously to the server for gameplay.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user opens the app, when they choose anonymous mode, then they can complete the survey and play games without creating an account, with profile data stored locally and sent anonymously to server for game functionality.
Error / Edge Cases: Local data loss; server sync issues.
Technical Notes: Local storage mechanism, anonymous user ID generation
Testing Notes: Test anonymous profile creation and gameplay; Test server communication without account.

Title: Anonymous Partner Information Entry
Description: The system shall allow the primary user to enter name and demographic information for an anonymous partner who will play without logging in.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user wants to play with an anonymous partner, when they set up the game, then they can enter the partner's name and demographic details which are used for the session only and not saved.
Error / Edge Cases: User skips entering partner info.
Testing Notes: Test that partner info is captured and used in session; Test that info is not persisted after session.

Title: Survey Flexibility Selection
Description: The system shall present users with options to skip the survey, take a condensed version (10 questions), or take the full survey, with full survey as the default flow.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user reaches the survey start screen, when the screen loads, then three options are displayed (Skip, Condensed, Full) with Full as the recommended/default option.
Error / Edge Cases: User selection not saved if they exit.
Testing Notes: Test all three survey paths; Test that default guides to full survey.

Title: Activity Countdown Display
Description: The system shall display a countdown of remaining activities for free users during gameplay.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a free user is playing a game, when an activity is completed or skipped, then the remaining activity count is updated and displayed in the game interface.
Error / Edge Cases: Counter display fails; counter desyncs from server.
Testing Notes: Test that countdown updates correctly; Test that it's only visible to free users.

Title: Truth Activity Definition
Description: The system shall generate Truth activities that require the player to answer a question.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a Truth activity is selected, when the activity is presented, then it contains a question that the player must answer verbally or in writing.
Technical Notes: Truth activity templates and question formats
Testing Notes: Test that Truth activities are always questions.

Title: Dare Activity Definition
Description: The system shall generate Dare activities that require the player to complete a physical action.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a Dare activity is selected, when the activity is presented, then it contains instructions for a physical action that the player must perform.
Technical Notes: Dare activity templates and action formats
Testing Notes: Test that Dare activities are always physical actions.

Title: Random Truth/Dare Selection
Description: The system shall randomly select between Truth and Dare activities with approximately 50/50 distribution over time.
Acceptance Criteria: Given multiple activities are requested, when the system selects activity types, then Truth and Dare are selected with equal probability, resulting in approximately 50/50 distribution over many activities.
Testing Notes: Test that Truth/Dare distribution approaches 50/50 over 100+ activities.

Title: Intimate Mode Soft Boundary Handling
Description: The system shall allow soft boundary topics to be offered in Intimate mode (X) while excluding only hard boundary topics.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a game is set to Intimacy Level X, when activities are generated, then soft boundary topics may be included but hard boundary topics are excluded.
Technical Notes: Boundary filtering logic for Intimate mode
Testing Notes: Test that Intimate mode excludes only hard boundaries; Test that soft boundaries are allowed.

Title: No-Repeat Threshold Enforcement
Description: The system shall enforce the no-repeat rule based on whichever threshold is reached first: 1 year or 100 activities.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has seen an activity, when checking for repeats, then the activity is excluded until either 1 year has passed OR the user has completed 100 additional activities, whichever comes first.
Error / Edge Cases: Edge case: exactly at threshold.
Testing Notes: Test both thresholds; Test that first threshold reached allows repeat.

Title: Player 2 Email Entry
Description: The system shall allow Player 1 to enter Player 2's email address to initiate a profile connection request.
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 1 enters a valid email address, when they submit the connection request, then Player 2 receives a push notification to confirm.
Error / Edge Cases: Invalid email format; Email not registered; Player 2 has notifications disabled.
Testing Notes: Test with valid/invalid emails; Test notification delivery

Title: Player 2 Connection Notification
Description: The system shall send a push notification to Player 2's device when Player 1 requests to connect their profile.
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 1 sends a connection request, when the request is processed, then Player 2 receives a push notification with Player 1's name and options to Accept or Decline.
Error / Edge Cases: Player 2 device offline; Notification permissions denied; Request expires after 5 minutes.
Technical Notes: FCM for Android, APNs for iOS
Testing Notes: Test notification delivery; Test accept/decline actions; Test expiration

Title: Player 2 Connection Confirmation
Description: The system shall allow Player 2 to accept or decline the connection request from their own device.
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 2 receives a connection notification, when they tap Accept, then their profile is temporarily connected to Player 1's game session and Player 1 is notified.
Error / Edge Cases: Request expired; Player 1 canceled request; Network error during confirmation.
Technical Notes: WebSocket or polling for real-time status updates
Testing Notes: Test accept flow; Test decline flow; Test timeout scenarios

Title: Connection Status Display
Description: The system shall display the connection request status to Player 1 (Waiting for confirmation, Accepted, Declined, Expired).
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 1 has sent a connection request, when the status changes, then the UI updates to reflect the current status.
Error / Edge Cases: Network disconnection during waiting; Status update delay.
Testing Notes: Test all status states; Test timeout behavior

Title: Remembered Partners Storage
Description: The system shall store a list of up to 10 recent partners that Player 1 has successfully connected with.
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 1 successfully connects with Player 2, when the connection is established, then Player 2 is added to Player 1's remembered partners list (most recent first).
Error / Edge Cases: List exceeds 10 partners (remove oldest); Storage failure.
Testing Notes: Test list limit; Test ordering; Test persistence

Title: Remembered Partners Display
Description: The system shall display the list of remembered partners on the Player 2 setup screen with quick reconnect options.
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 1 has remembered partners, when they reach the Player 2 setup screen, then they see a list of recent partners with "Connect" buttons.
Error / Edge Cases: Empty list; Partner deleted their account.
Testing Notes: Test with empty list; Test with full list; Test quick reconnect

Title: Remove Remembered Partner
Description: The system shall allow Player 1 to remove a partner from their remembered partners list.
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 1 views their remembered partners, when they swipe left (iOS) or long-press (Android) and select Delete, then the partner is removed from the list.
Error / Edge Cases: Accidental deletion (confirmation dialog).
Testing Notes: Test delete gesture; Test confirmation; Test list update

Title: Profile Sharing Settings
Description: The system shall provide settings for users to control profile visibility: All responses, Overlapping responses only (Neutral or positive on Likert scale), No responses.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user accesses profile settings, when they select a sharing preference, then that preference is saved and applied to all future connections.
Error / Edge Cases: Default to "Overlapping responses only".
Technical Notes: Likert scale: Neutral (3), Agree (4), Strongly Agree (5) are shared
Testing Notes: Test all three settings; Test default behavior

Title: Dual-Profile Activity Personalization
Description: The system shall generate activities based on both Player 1 and Player 2 profiles when both are connected.
Acceptance Criteria: Given both players have connected profiles, when an activity is generated, then it considers both players' survey responses, preferences, and boundaries.
Error / Edge Cases: One player has incomplete survey; Conflicting boundaries.
Testing Notes: Test with both complete profiles; Test with one incomplete

Title: Receiving Player Boundary Check
Description: The system shall enforce that activities only respect the receiving player's boundaries (the player who will receive the action).
Acceptance Criteria: Given an activity is generated, when it involves one player doing something to another, then the activity only checks the receiving player's boundaries, not the giving player's boundaries.
Error / Edge Cases: Unclear which player is receiving; Bidirectional activities.
Technical Notes: Activity metadata must specify giver/receiver roles
Testing Notes: Test with asymmetric boundaries; Test role clarity

Title: Profile Re-authentication Prompt
Description: The system shall require Player 2 to re-authenticate via push notification confirmation for each new game session, even if they are a remembered partner.
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 1 selects a remembered partner, when they initiate connection, then Player 2 receives a new confirmation notification.
Error / Edge Cases: Player 2 declines re-authentication.
Testing Notes: Test re-auth for remembered partners; Test decline scenario

Title: Display Own Profile Details
Description: The system shall display the user's complete intimacy profile including all 25 survey questions with their responses, profile visualization (radar chart/tags), and archetype description.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user has completed the survey, when they tap "View Details", then they see all questions with their responses displayed in a scrollable view.
Error / Edge Cases: Incomplete survey; No responses saved.
Technical Notes: Display questions in same order as survey
Testing Notes: Test with complete/incomplete surveys; Test scrolling performance

Title: Navigate to Edit Survey
Description: The system shall provide an "Edit Responses" link that navigates to the survey with all responses pre-populated and editable.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user views their profile, when they tap "Edit Responses", then the survey opens with all previous responses pre-filled and user can modify any response.
Error / Edge Cases: Survey data not found.
Technical Notes: Pre-populate form fields with saved responses
Testing Notes: Test pre-population; Test saving edited responses

Title: Save Edited Survey Responses
Description: The system shall save edited survey responses and regenerate the profile visualization and boundaries.
Acceptance Criteria: Given a user edits survey responses, when they complete editing, then responses are saved, boundaries are recalculated, and profile visualization is updated.
Error / Edge Cases: Network error during save; Partial responses.
Testing Notes: Test save success; Test boundary updates; Test profile refresh

Title: Display Partner Profile - All Responses
Description: The system shall display Player 2's complete profile (all survey responses and visualization) when their sharing setting is "All Responses".
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 2 shares all responses, when Player 1 views their profile, then all 25 questions with responses and visualization are displayed (read-only).
Error / Edge Cases: Player 2 profile incomplete.
Technical Notes: Same layout as own profile but read-only
Testing Notes: Test display with complete profile; Verify read-only

Title: Display Partner Profile - Overlapping Only
Description: The system shall display only overlapping responses (where both players answered Neutral, Agree, or Strongly Agree) when Player 2's sharing setting is "Overlapping Only".
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 2 shares overlapping only, when Player 1 views their profile, then only questions where both answered 3, 4, or 5 on Likert scale are shown.
Error / Edge Cases: No overlapping responses; Player 1 incomplete survey.
Technical Notes: Filter responses: show only where both >= 3 on Likert scale
Testing Notes: Test with various overlap scenarios; Test with no overlap

Title: Display Partner Profile - Demographics Only
Description: The system shall display only demographic information (sex, orientation, relationship structure) when Player 2's sharing setting is "No Responses".
Acceptance Criteria: Given Player 2 shares no responses, when Player 1 views their profile, then only demographics are displayed with no survey responses or visualization.
Error / Edge Cases: Demographics not provided.
Technical Notes: Simple card layout with demographics only
Testing Notes: Test display with demographics only

Title: Display Settings Screen
Description: The system shall display a settings screen with sections for Profile & Privacy, Account, Subscription, Partner Management, Notifications, and About.
Acceptance Criteria: User taps hamburger menu and sees settings with all sections. Anonymous users see grayed-out sections for account-specific settings.
Error / Edge Cases: Anonymous users cannot access account settings.
Technical Notes: Single scrollable page with collapsible sections
Testing Notes: Test with registered and anonymous users

Title: Update Profile Sharing Setting
Description: The system shall allow users to change their global profile sharing setting (All Responses, Overlapping Only, Demographics Only).
Acceptance Criteria: User selects sharing preference in Settings and it is saved and applied to all future connections.
Testing Notes: Test setting persistence across sessions

Title: Email Signup Form
Description: The system shall display an email signup form with email and password fields, validation, and account creation.
Acceptance Criteria: User enters valid email and password (min 8 chars), account is created, and user proceeds to demographics.
Non-Functional Needs: Email format validation, password strength indicator
Error / Edge Cases: Email already exists, weak password, network error.
Testing Notes: Test validation, duplicate email, password requirements

Title: Request Push Notification Permission
Description: The system shall request OS-level push notification permission with explanation of why it is needed.
Acceptance Criteria: User sees permission request with context, grants or denies, and preference is saved.
Error / Edge Cases: User denies permission, permission already granted.
Technical Notes: Request after login or before first connection attempt
Testing Notes: Test on both platforms, test deny scenario

Title: Display Subscription Plans
Description: The system shall display subscription plans with pricing, features, and purchase buttons.
Acceptance Criteria: User sees monthly ($4.99) and annual ($29.99) plans with feature comparison and can select to purchase.
Error / Edge Cases: User already subscribed, payment method issues.
Technical Notes: Integrate with App Store/Play Store billing
Testing Notes: Test purchase flow, test with existing subscription

Title: Process Subscription Payment
Description: The system shall process subscription payment through platform billing and update user subscription status.
Acceptance Criteria: User completes payment, subscription is activated, and user sees confirmation.
Error / Edge Cases: Payment declined, network error, duplicate purchase.
Technical Notes: Use platform billing APIs (StoreKit, Google Play Billing)
Testing Notes: Test with test accounts, test error scenarios

Title: Display Payment Success
Description: The system shall display payment success confirmation with subscription details and return to game option.
Acceptance Criteria: User sees success message, subscription tier, and can return to gameplay.
Technical Notes: Auto-dismiss after 3 seconds or manual continue
Testing Notes: Test navigation back to game

Title: Forgot Password Request
Description: The system shall allow users to request password reset email by entering their email address.
Acceptance Criteria: User enters email, receives reset link via email, and can reset password.
Error / Edge Cases: Email not found, email delivery failure.
Technical Notes: Generate secure reset token with expiration
Testing Notes: Test with valid/invalid emails, test token expiration

Title: Display Legal Content
Description: The system shall display Privacy Policy and Terms of Service in scrollable text pages.
Acceptance Criteria: User can access and read Privacy Policy and Terms from Welcome screen and Settings.
Technical Notes: Simple text pages with back navigation
Testing Notes: Test scrolling, test navigation

Title: Delete Account with Confirmation
Description: The system shall allow users to delete their account with confirmation modal and warning about data loss.
Acceptance Criteria: User selects delete account, sees warning, confirms, and account is deleted with all data.
Error / Edge Cases: Active subscription, network error.
Technical Notes: Delete all user data, cancel subscriptions
Testing Notes: Test data deletion, test subscription cancellation

Title: Display Home/Dashboard Screen
Description: The system shall display a home screen for returning users with "Let's Get Attuned" CTA, profile summary, and quick access to settings.
Acceptance Criteria: Returning user sees home screen with game CTA, taps CTA and goes to Player 2 Setup with last partner pre-filled.
Error / Edge Cases: First-time user, no previous partner.
Technical Notes: Remember last partner for quick replay
Testing Notes: Test with/without previous partner

Title: Display Player 2 Notification
Description: The system shall display a notification screen for Player 2 showing connection request with Player 1 details and Accept/Decline options.
Acceptance Criteria: Player 2 receives push notification, opens app, sees request details, and can accept or decline.
Error / Edge Cases: Request expired, multiple requests.
Technical Notes: Deep link from notification to request screen
Testing Notes: Test notification delivery, test accept/decline
